Detailed Description

Base Class for ToolChangers.

The ToolChanger class is a generic base class for all ToolChanger classes. It contains functionality to open the ToolChanger, close the ToolChanger and find the state of the ToolChanger. The implementation for a specific ToolChanger is done in a derived class. For example, the DefaultToolChanger class.

Example Program: 

//======================================================================== 
// Project: Robotic Platform
// ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
// Package: 
// Authors: 
// Start Date: Thu May 31 05:30:31 GMT 2001
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------  
// File: Gripper.t.cpp
// Example program for the class Gripper.
//========================================================================  
 

// ----- Standard Libaries -----
#include <iostream.h>

// ----- QRTS Libraries -----

// ----- Project Includes -----
#include "RoboticPlatform.hpp"
#include "Gripper.hpp"

 
 
//======================================================================== 
// main
//========================================================================  
 
int main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
  RoboticPlatform::init(argc, argv);

  RoboticPlatform::exit();
  return 0;
}

bool isLocked ( ) [pure virtual]
 

Determines if the ToolChanger is locked.

Returns:
true: If the ToolChanger is locked.
false: If the ToolChanger is unlocked.

Reimplemented in DefaultToolChanger.

void relax ( ) [pure virtual]
 

Relaxes the ToolChanger ( Does not apply any force to the ToolChanger).

Reimplemented in DefaultToolChanger.
